bill_title: make an appropriation from the general fund for the promotion of South Dakota.
keywords: Department of Tourism and State Development

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation from the general fund for the promotion of South Dakota. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of two million dollars ($2,000,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department or Tourism and State Development to promote and increase the level of tourism in South Dakota. Section 2. The secretary of the Department of Tourism and State Development shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 3. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2005, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
